title: How did Dennis Ritchie produce his PhD thesis? A typographical mystery (2022) [pdf]
dot:
digraph RitchieThesis{rankdir=TB;node[shape=box];Thesis[label="Dennis Ritchie's PhD Thesis
'Program Structure and Computational Complexity'
(1968)"];Disappearance[label="Disappearance
- Thesis lost for 50 years
- Found by sister in 2011"];Degree[label="PhD Degree
- Never officially received
- Reasons unclear"];TechnicalContribution[label="Technical Contribution
- Recursive function theory
- Turing-complete model"]; Preparation[label="Thesis Preparation
- High-quality typesetting
- Early document preparation challenges"];TypographicalMystery[label="Typographical Mystery
- Precision in layout
- Use of electric typewriters
- Use of IBM 2741 terminal"]; Background[label="Background
- 1960s typing technology
- Electric typewriters vs.
electronic typesetters"];Tools[label="Tools Used
- IBM Selectric Typewriter
- RUNOFF text formatting program
- troff and eqn for typesetting"]; Versions[label="Versions of Thesis
- January 1968 draft (60 typos)
- Corrected version found later"];Restoration[label="Restoration Efforts
- Recreated using troff
- Challenges in typesetting"]; Thesis->Disappearance;Thesis->Degree;Thesis->TechnicalContribution;Thesis->Preparation; Preparation->TypographicalMystery;Preparation->Background;Preparation->Tools; TechnicalContribution->Versions;Versions->Restoration;}
